answer: Electromyography (EMG) measures the speed of impulse conduction along nerves.
false_answer: Electromyography (EMG) measures the speed of impulse conduction along nerves.
incorrect_explanation: This statement incorrectly attributes the primary purpose of nerve conduction studies to electromyography. In contrast, nerve conduction studies specifically apply electrical stimuli to nerves to measure the speed of impulse conduction.
question: What does Electromyography (EMG) primarily measure?
